glsa.title: Festival: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Festival could result in arbitrary code execution, and privilege escalation.

background.p: Festival is a Text to Speech Engine from The Centre for Speech Technology Research.

description.p: A vulnerability in Festival Server has an incorrect path in LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which allows local users to place a Trojan horse shared library in the current working directory.

impact.p: A local attacker can execute arbitrary a Trojan horse shared library, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution and privilege escalation.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Festival users should upgrade to the latest version:
